note: Extreme poverty data is expressed in [international-$](#dod:int_dollar_abbreviation) at 2017 prices. Depending on the country and year, it relates to income measured after taxes and benefits, or to consumption, [per capita](#dod:per-capita). Multidimensional poverty is based on the most recent household survey data (between 2011 and 2023).
title: Share of population living on less than $3.65 per day vs. share in multidimensional poverty
subtitle: The poverty line of $3.65 per day is set by the World Bank to be representative of the definitions of poverty adopted in lower-middle-income countries. Multidimensional poverty is defined as being deprived in a range of health, education and living standards indicators.
